key_points: A prop firearm discharged on the 'Rust' movie set outside Santa Fe, killing a woman and injuring a man.
The victims were crew members, a 42-year-old woman who later died and a 42-year-old man receiving emergency care.
Production of the Western movie 'Rust' has been halted; Alec Baldwin is involved as a producer and actor.
A spokesperson for Baldwin described the incident as an accident involving the misfire of a prop gun with blanks.
Alec Baldwin was seen in tears outside the sheriff’s office but did not comment on the incident.
The Santa Fe County Sheriff’s Office is investigating the discharge of the prop firearm and the type of projectile.
Deputies responded to the incident after receiving 911 calls about a person being shot on set.
The movie 'Rust' was scheduled to continue filming into early November.
The plot centers around a 13-year-old boy who goes on the run with his grandfather (Baldwin) in 1880s Kansas.
It recalls past fatal incidents involving prop guns on set, including the deaths of Brandon Lee in 1993 and Jon-Erik Hexum in 1984.
